website_summaries.verdict: A mid-range option with some nice features – and some concerns to consider before buying.
pros: Though not as powerful as BLACK+DECKER's top-of-the-line model, it sports similar features such as the PowerCommand option that saves battery power during easy tasks
cons: Issues with the auto cord feed malfunctioning have been reported
Some found the position of the trigger and adjustable grip  awkward
Some reports of it not working shortly after purchase

website_summaries.verdict: This top notch model in BLACK+DECKER's line of combo trimmer-edgers earns high marks for being energy efficient and powerful while giving a clean, accurate edge to lawns.
pros: This model includes a dual-mode accelerator switch, allowing users to toggle between longer battery life or more power, depending on needs at the time
At 8 pounds, most adult users will have no problem navigating this unit to cut exactly where they want, for an accurate lawn edge and trim
Two 1.5 amp-hour lithium-ion batteries are included
Each can last for up to an hour on run-time mode, and the automatic feed spool means no stopping to untangle or feed more line
cons: For large yards or big jobs, the battery may not have the capacity to complete the job without charging

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I own 8 acres. Three I maintain and landscape, the other 5 are woods. When I mentioned getting one of these everyone I spoke with said battery weed eaters are horrible. NOT true! On the two litium batteries, I can weedeat the entire landscaped property without the pain of mixing oil and gas for fuel, fighting with the pull start and lugging all that weight around. If this can take care of my property I'm sure it can handle others!
customer_reviews.author: Ike LaRue

customer_reviews.title: I call this thing my "Barbie Doll" Weedeater....it's a toy.
customer_reviews.text: It's so lightweight it's almost like a toy.!! If my granddaughter was a little older I'd give it to her. Three is too young. I fully charged both batteries over night before using it. Used this thing for 10 minutes on some spindly, skinny weeds. It's pretty wimpy. Haven't messed with it since. It's leaned on the wall on my front porch for weeks. Maybe someone will steal it...?? Even ordered an extra spool of exact specified line. And then, I got online and ordered a factory refurbished gas weedeater from Home Depot. Free delivery $70.
customer_reviews.author: TX Sasquatch

customer_reviews.title: We'll see how long the second one lasts
customer_reviews.text: This is our second BLACK+DECKER LST420 20V MAX Lithium High Performance Trimmer and Edger, 12" that we have owned. In it's third year, the first one stopped advancing the trimmer line. The line compartment had to be opened and the line advanced manually. When the B&D trimmer/edger works, it works well, but manually advancing the line doubles the trim time. We have 1.5 acres with a lot of concrete, shrub areas, and play areas to trim around. We decided to try this trimmer one more time because we already own so many batteries that fit it. We need 4-5 batteries to do all of our trimming. It easily converts between a trimmer and an edger.
customer_reviews.author: Joyful Nana

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different brand
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in January of 2016. A few months ago the trimmer line stopped spinning, which required my husband to take the whole thing apart to fix it. It worked for a few more months, but is broken again. Time to replace with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelming trimmer power
customer_reviews.text: I've used a Black & Decker 18v GrassHog for a number of years for light edging and trimming and purchased this new 20v "high performance" model thinking it was time to try a more modern upgrade and perhaps expand my trimming to the woods in back of the house. This trimmer has two power settings. On the higher power setting my experience was that this trimmer was significantly weaker than my older GrassHog. The lower power (longer battery life) setting struck me as particularly useless. It's always possible this is an anomaly for the unit I received. I returned this trimmer, and have renewed appreciation for my older B&D GrassHog.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, not great results
customer_reviews.text: It is probably a great option for some customers but I have a small/medium sized St. Augustine yard and it didn't work well for me. It trims good enough but you really need to run it on power 2 setting which kills the battery. It also was unable to edge effectively at all, operationally speaking it works well but it just needs more power/torque. It was nice to have a second battery but with needing to run it on 2 I was only able to do my front yard before they both died.
customer_reviews.author: Maximus

customer_reviews.title: PORTABILITY!
customer_reviews.text: My yard is 300' plus out the back of my house. Have a corded weedeater but that *^#@ got really old, really fast! The 2 batteries that that came with trimmer are great! I use them in multiple Black & Decker tools I already own, so no complaints there as I now have 4 battery packs total. String is tough as nails. Took a real beating along the privacy fence and kept the length remarkably. Approximately 700 ' of privacy fence trimming I had neglected and used it as an edger on the patio all on one battery. I highly recommend this. It just makes yardwork so much simpler and a little more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Williams

customer_reviews.title: Convenient Trimmer with a Frustrating Grip for Edger Mode
customer_reviews.text: This Trimmer/ Edger is a great overall product with several flaws. The battery is long lasting (I typically use mine for 30 to 45 minutes with no issues). It also comes with two batteries which helpful for larger yards and projects. The main benefit of this trimmer is that it is light. The weight makes yard projects easy to complete without fatigue. My main complaint is that the hand grip is height adjustable but does not adjust around the trimmer. When in edger mode, the hand grip requires an awkward arm positioning which is fatiguing. The ability to twist the hand grip would fix this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred

customer_reviews.title: So Easy to Use for Edging
customer_reviews.text: I had an old electric Black and Decker trimmer, but the line didn't feed very well. This battery operated trimmer is so easy to use. The line feeds seamlessly with no jams or glitches to the end of the spool. It can be used for edging or trimming simply by bushing a button and turning the handle and there is plenty of battery power to edge a city lot several times
customer_reviews.author: Maplewood Girl

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know about high ratings but that’s what led me to by this. The wife (whom is 60 somthing) used it four times and it wasn’t long in use at any of those times. The motor over heated and quite working. I strongly DO NOT suggest this to be a good product for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John Wayne Lea

customer_reviews.title: Great Yard Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a gas powered that I really did not enjoy using. I decided that I needed a new lithium trimmer and after doing some research I decided on purchasing the Black + Decker. It was very easy to put together out of the box and after I charged the battery I was ready to use it for the first time. I have a fairly large yard and I was able to finish on one battery about 20 minutes worth. I have used the trimmer several times since and it has worked flawlessly every time even the auto feed, it is no where as powerful as my gas trimmer but it has all the power that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Battery charger is not working!!
customer_reviews.text: Battery charger has already failed. When plugged in it only has a red light flashing with no battery attached. Tried to charge the battery and it will still only flashes red. Tired to charge both batteries and they will not charge. Not sure if it is the batteries or the charger. Included instructions do not say anything about the flashing read light. Not happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Terri Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Just after 1 year it sucks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this May 2018 work good and worked the first time this year. I went out and put battery in that was charging overnite it has a red light which I means the battery is bad. Probably did not even charge it 5 times. The other battery I put it in and unit works 30 seconds stops . I turn it back on 30 seconds and stops again. I Am very disappointed Black and Decker an will look for a different brand to take its place
customer_reviews.author: Tom's Foolery

customer_reviews.title: but I bought this product over a year ago and it still seems like brand new
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe, but I bought this product over a year ago and it still seems like brand new. I have used this trimmer every week (not including December-February,) and have still not had to change the spool. It's lightweight and easy to use. I have a quarter acre lot & rarely have to switch to the second battery. Best trimmer ever!
customer_reviews.author: Mdtracy

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer for me
customer_reviews.text: this is my 3rd time buying this type of trimmers. It is just too hard for me to handle the big gas trimmers and I don't like dragging a cord around for the electric trimmers. This trimmer seems to work very well and I do have 3 batteries so I'm all set to do a lot of trimming if need be. It take a little time to get used to the edger feature but again easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: SunshineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: After researching reviews and visiting stores to get a hands on feel for various brands and prices - settled on this model, glad I did. Purchased in May and have used weekly since. Single line has enough power for moderate weeds and trimming. Batteries last around 35 minutes each - more than enough for my needs, and no issues when charging with included charger. Light weight and easy to handle, automatic string advance works as expected (I'm still on my initial spool). Though made of plastic it seems well built. Good value for the price, glad I didn't spend more.
customer_reviews.author: chasmoose

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: This is the third B&D trimmer/edger I've had in the past 6-7 years, each with a different type of battery. I've got to say, each model has become progressively weaker. If you want to use this one as an edger, forget it. I often have to go over the same grass 4-5 times. And I thought the wheel was a great idea until I tried edging in a straight line with it. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rambo

customer_reviews.title: Great product - easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: I have to maintain a small property without electricity and I am hopeless with gas powered models so I took a chance on this. It works better than my electric trimmer so I am now using it exclusively. Having two batteries has been wonderful - especially when unable to get to an outlet. The trimmer was easy to put together, is sturdy, and gets the job done. Update - Purchased this in July 2015 and just replaced the string spool. The original string lasted much longer than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good for what it is
customer_reviews.text: What it is, is light weight and convenient. The two batteries make it a price bargain since lithium batteries usually cost around 50 to replace. I have a quarter acre lot with two sides wooded and I can trim the lot on one battery. I use the low setting. If I need more power for heavy stuff, I use an old and much more powerful electric. It's light line and only one, but it takes care of the St Augustine grass and trims the driveway. I would have given it a five, but for the fact that the automatic line release works only inconsistently - I often have to open the spool and work out some additional line.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: For lite frequent jobs
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for lite-to-average use. Beware this does not have the power for tough beaver rip jobs. But weekly home lawn trimmings this works fine. It is very lite weight and quiet. Battery life seems fine so far. Comes with two batteries and charger so if you already have B&D 20v tools this just adds more batteries for other jobs. Honestly had reservations going into this purchase but I think it'll work out fine so long as the quality lasts. I'm a fit 40+ male who doesn't mind lugging around loud, smelly equipment so long as the tools get the job done. Admittedly, it's kinda nice not carrying around the fumes and noise of a gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: milgrade

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a lightweight, strong, electric trimmer and this one fits the bill. We have a half acre lot and this edges the front and back yard, all flower beds, and around a jungle gym on one battery. It's extremely lightweight and I have no issue (strength wise) edging/trimming with it after mowing. I've been using it weekly for four months and am at the end of the first roll of string. It's very user friendly and it is simple to turn the head to use it as an edger.
customer_reviews.author: MommaLazer

customer_reviews.title: This works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This worked like a champ. I used it for everything and was pretty happy with the results. For about six months, then it started to smoke..... and now it doesn't work.. UPDATE - Black & Decker replaced the unit and by doing so give me a new battery. Very satisfied. I am really happy that I got a new battery because the two that come with this unit only last about 15-25 min/battery on the high setting. And it takes me about an hour to do everything in my yard. The LST400 model of this comes with one extra large battery that lasts about 30-45 min on high.
customer_reviews.author: Natrone!

customer_reviews.title: Great product but line refills are expensive.  Refill your own with a cordless drill.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but a little under powered. If you just have grass edging and trimming to do, this will work. Anything heavier.....get a gasoline weedeater. Also, if you choose to refill your own line, fasten the spool to an electric drill and at a slow speed, carefully wind the line onto the spool as EVENLY as possible (just like filling a bobbin). I use a 1/2 inch drill bit with some duct take wound around the end to secure the spool onto the bit (a spade bit will also work). Insert the bit into the the center of the larger hole on the spool and wind the line onto the spool by running the drill in reverse.
customer_reviews.author: Barkin'dog

customer_reviews.title: Heck of a good price for a very capable cordless trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this trimmer. Lightweight but has not pulled any punches while helping to restore the neglected lawn at my new house. Working in trimmer mode it quickly zips through the light stuff and will cut down heavy grass too but not as easily. It switches to edger mode by pressing a button and rotating the head 180 degrees, and as an edger I'm quite impressed in its ability to clean up the edges of my lawn. I keep it in the higher power mode at all times and it will go 10-15 minutes on a fully charged battery. Make sure you have a few fully charged up before you start..
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Headhunter

customer_reviews.title: Working good. The cable string is a little short.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like adequate power. I did have a gas one before. This one takes probably 10% more time to do the job. I had the choice to send it back but decided to keep it. Battery life is good. I can do 15 minutes of weed whacking on One battery. Never had to use the other one yet. Like I said though the cable is a little short which makes the job a little longer to do. Overall a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Performing as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the package arriving so mauled I assumed it was hiding raw meat and been attacked by a cougar, the experience thus far is great. Have used it at least six times to trim a 3/4 acre lot. Very glad I have two batteries, never run our of juice; just carrying the second with me as I go. Does it edge? Yes, quite well! Very satisfied. (Why not 5 stars? For me, 5 stars means I am getting emotional....
customer_reviews.author: D2Omaha

customer_reviews.title: and not for anyone over 5' 6" to use comfortably. The only reason it gets two stars is ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a very small back lawn for which we use this device, and the battery doesn't even last long enough to trim the grass in one charge. Only a couple months after we purchased it, the rod broke. It's cheaply constructed, almost toy-like, and not for anyone over 5' 6" to use comfortably. The only reason it gets two stars is because it's easy to store inside a small garage. I don't recall ever being disappointed in a B&D before, so this was a surprise.
customer_reviews.author: CandD

customer_reviews.title: Battery issue
customer_reviews.text: I am giving it one star because it has no explanation of the symbols on the charger. On my first attempt to use this, it would not work. I thought that since I had charged the batteries a week earlier that I needed to charge them again. One battery blinked red when inserted, the other blinked green once then nothing. The "instruction manual" needs to included more info on troubleshooting. Are the batteries faulty or..?
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great Light Trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I writing this review on behalf of my wife. My loves this weed whacker a lot better than the gas powered one we have. She likes it that is light weight, battery operated, edger and has two different power setting to choose from. When converting it from whacking grass to edging is a breeze. Granted we only live in town and don't have anything thick brush to trim down, but the battery will last a couple trimmings before needing to be recharged.
customer_reviews.author: Mikenedge

customer_reviews.title: Really great weedwacker
customer_reviews.text: Love that it came with two batteries. Can get most of my 1/3 of an acre done in the 40 minutes of battery it has. Works consistently strong until it just stops when the battery dies (pro and con to that since you really have no idea the battery is about to die.) Lightweight and I like that it's adjustable (I'm short so adjusting it for my height is a plus.)
customer_reviews.author: MineandYours

customer_reviews.title: Best trimmer I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: I've used it several times now and it's great ! No problem. Batt life is good and I'm really impressed with the line feed. That was always an issue with past string trimmers. It's not heavy or noisy. Gas trimmers were always both, if you could get one started. Edge cutting feature works very well too. Looks like it'll last. I'm sold, 5 Stars worth!
customer_reviews.author: Kentuckian

customer_reviews.title: Not much power and very little edge capability
customer_reviews.text: Very little power. Returned and opted for the 40v brushless. This model is only good if you have very thin grass and I would not buy it to edge with as it barely handles that function. Has good run time however you will virtually never have it on the low speed due to its low power so that drains the battery quicker. Wheel tends to get in the way. The 40volt brushless is more but it is a powertool where this model is really more of a garden toy. Pay the extra, you will be floored. If you have thin grass and don't need it to edge, then this model will work fine. Just don't expect more.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny P

customer_reviews.title: Best yard tool I've bought !
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida am a 55 year old gal and do my own 1/3 acre yard, I could never find a decent weed wacker in 20+ years. This is perfect, lightweight (photo), adjustable and has 2 lithium batteries that charge pretty quick, and its VERY powerful, cuts through heavy stuff. Had to write this review, been meaning to for the past three years! Thank you Black & Decker, I love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Deb & Dan

customer_reviews.title: This is a great weed wacker and the price was great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great weed wacker and the price was great. Includes charger and two batteries. We have a big back yard and it will run for a good half hour before swapping batteries is required. Plenty of power for our needs and the auto feed seems to work well. I hate having gas mowers and appliances around. Noise and messy although admittedly they have more power. But for our needs this meets the bill and its power is not to be underestimated. I highly recommend this sturdy little tool for ordinary garden needs. I wouldn't recommend it for clearing large fields or farming applications but I think that goes without saying. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Reali

customer_reviews.title: I'm close to 70 and use a push mower to ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm close to 70 and use a push mower to cut grass in our small back yard. Trimming around the fence, under bushes, under the deck where the mower can't go and around the the sides of the house as well as edging the sidewalks really requires use of a trimmer-edger. No more down on my hands and knees trying to edge with garden shears and clippers! This Black + Decker was reasonably priced and has made my life so much easier! Went together quickly, it's not too large or heavy and I can have a well trimmed yard in a fraction of the time I spent before and with much less effort!
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Great weed eater
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Fathers Day. He really wanted a gas powered one but most of those require you to mix oil and gasoline and since I knew I would be the only one to ever use it I made sure that I got one that I wanted. (Sad, but true.) My husband liked it and I took it out to try it for the first time today. I was really worried about how powerful it would be since it is battery operated but WOW! This thing gets the job done! Definitely worth buying!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Shay

customer_reviews.title: Edging and trimming so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love! Yes, bought it in Winter/Spring 2014 on sale from Amazon, or something - so when it arrived, I couldn't wait for Younger Son to perform his weekly chore of doing the yard work. HE didn't like it, and his first use of the B&D was awkward, until I showed him some Amazon and YouTube videos of other owners reviewing their B&D. He's a pro now, and this has made his weekly yard work absolutely easy. He doesn't even complain anymore about taking care of the yard. My father-in-law commented to my mother-in-law that Husband (their son) kept the front yard so professional looking. With a grin, Husband admitted it was all Younger Son's handiwork.
customer_reviews.author: Tim and Juanita

customer_reviews.title: Very light and easy to use. Impressive battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I ditched my gas-powered trimmer for this one. It's light, easy to use and powerful enough for most trimming jobs. I wouldn't recommend it for clearing a patch of blackberries, but for routine yard maintenance, it's great. I'm more likely to actually do the trimming now that I have this. Battery power is impressive. One battery outlasts my usual trimming job and it comes with two. The two power settings give you the options for longer running or harder hitting.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Slemp

customer_reviews.title: Using it like that, it runs about 10-15 minutes on a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is one tough little weedwacker. It's not too heavy either. It cuts down briars, and saplings, then trims bare to the ground on my woods paths. Using it like that, it runs about 10-15 minutes on a battery-I have 3 batteries for that reason. If something gets wrapped around the spinner, it shuts itself off which is a nice feature(ivy roots). I have used it quite a bit, and have not had to replace the trimmer cord yet. The power of 20 volts over my last 18 volt unit, is unbelievable. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Love it for cutting grass in smallish yard!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use to cut grass in my smallish back and front yards - love it!! So lightweight and easy to use. Works beautifully on all types of grass and weeds. For years had been using an old-fashioned motor-less push motor because I don't like the noise a lawnmower makes and also because I was trying to be "green." Well, this item does the trick quickly, easily, quietly, and the battery is easy to charge. This trimmer is so lightweight and easy to use that it actually makes a dreaded chore seem pleasant and, wow, I can get the lawn cut so easily. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: woodb

customer_reviews.title: Only worth it for a TINY yard
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes this would work for a small yard. But even in power mode, it barely keeps up with even semi tall grass. Go with the higher end or even gas trimmer if you have anything more than a tiny townhouse yard.
customer_reviews.author: Rainy

customer_reviews.title: Good trimmer, better than previous 18V one
customer_reviews.text: We have a LOT of trimming, with a 2 acre lot with many trees, rocks and gardens. I used to go thru 10 to 12 18V batteries. Now I've upgraded to a 20V trimmer, and have six batteries and three rapid chargers (every walk back to the house for fresh batteries involves a steep uphill walk). The trimmer is a real upgrade: multiple power output choices, sturdier build. The batteries are lighter than the 18V NiCads, but don't last a lot longer except for the white extra charge ones. Lighter batteries help with the fatigue factor (I'm 72 years old and 5'2"). Luckily it uses the same trimmer cord as the 18V one.
customer_reviews.author: Country Doc

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this trimmer for my 78 yr old moms residence. She lives in a new subdivision in a small town. She has a total of about 15 minutes worth of trimming around house and shrubs. Most of what needs trimming in her yard is light fescue. This trimmer works great for jobs like her house. Light duty only. Larger weeds will require a gas trimmer. I have used it appx 6-7 times and it has performed well. In fact, I get the full 20-30 minutes (2 trims) out of one charged battery. If you live in the country or do commercial work, this trimmer is not for you. However, it works well as advertised for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Redbo

customer_reviews.title: All most homes need.
customer_reviews.text: For a small suburban home, this is about all you need. I have a normal electric one, but it's cumbersome to be dragging around the extension cord. I'd say that from now on, this will be what I use 98% of the time... for the other 2%, I can fall back on the plug based one. I've never even burned through a whole battery, so two batteries is a bit superfluous for my needs. Very light as well. I no longer dread trimming.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Myers

customer_reviews.title: Love the versatility of this tool
customer_reviews.text: Love the versatility of this tool. The pole telescopes so it's got enough length for me and can be shortened up for the wife to use. Quickly and easily converts from trimmer to edger. Automatic feed for the string works better than expected. Love the dual mode accelerator switch to give you added power or lower to extend battery life. The only drawback is that it lacks power to quickly get through heavier, denser vegetation like grows in our back yard. As long as you keep ahead of it, it does just fine.
customer_reviews.author: coach316dc

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I did not expect this to work very well. Weak compared to my old gas 4 cycle Ryobi multi-purpose device (which is a beast, very powerful) but IT DOES WORK WELL if you take your time. I'm very happy with standard trimming ability. Nice and light, 1 Battery good for about 1 1/2 average suburban lots or uses. Line easy to replace, also feeds well and lasts a fairly long time.
customer_reviews.author: J Reid

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER LST420 20V MAX Lithium High Performance Trimmer and Edger, 12"
customer_reviews.text: So far I am pretty impressed. I was happy with my 13 year old 18 V B & D Grass Hog but the battery was wearing out. I was looking for another and found this. Besides being lighter it's great that it comes with 2 20 V rechargeable batteries, although I haven't yet been able to completely drain one while trimming my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Dave in STL

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Efficient
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace old corded Weedeater for ease of use. Very lightweight and efficient. The 2 speeds allow heavier cutting. The automatic string feature is great and string has lasted a long time. It also means the string does not sometimes get longer and attack your ankles! Having 2 batteries makes quick work of lawn. I should have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: CusterHank

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to adjust the length
customer_reviews.text: This product should make gas trimmers illegal if you live in a neighborhood. Much quieter then gas, battery lasts about 30 minutes and if you have the other one charged and ready to go most yards should be able to be done in an hour. If not, this may not be the right tool for the job. Light and easy to adjust the length. With prime it came in no time and Amazon does a great job with making sure you are happy. So if it breaks in a year from regular use you can send it back for another. Great product again and you should buy it if you are looking for a trimmer. Can't imagine why you wouldn't...
customer_reviews.author: Nate.G

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought a WORX
customer_reviews.text: Used this only three times for a total of less than an hour and a half when it simply stopped working. Amazon's return policy has expired and I cannot get any reply from Black and Decker except to mail it to California. I have many of the MAX 20 volt products but this one is a great disappointment. This will definitely influence my future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: squareacrefarm

customer_reviews.title: Just what the tall grass ordered
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. I have. .5 acre yard surrounded by picket fence, One battery and spare was enough to trim all, as well as around 10 trees. It’s light, easy to hold, and does the job. I did try to use as an edger a bit along drive and sidewalk and found it a bit lacking. But good for the main job of trimming stragglers.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Nice trimmer, It takes both batteries to complete my larger lake from yard, but that was expected. Handles tall grass down by the lake shore with relative ease and also edges nicely. This is easy to use and maneuver. Glad I made the purchase, was not sure what to expect from my first battery operated trimmer. I've had corded and gas trimmers and by far, this unit exceeds my expectations. Glad I no longer need to untangle cords or mix gas and oil. I am glad I made this purchase and I do recommend this Black and Decker Unit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like that it has too modes
customer_reviews.text: Definitely needs 2 batteries to do the entire front, back and side yard (our yard is very small). Does a decent job of cutting grass but I have found that if you go a long time between cuts that it has a hard time cutting a very thick piece of grass stem. I don't consider this a con since it's not meant for heavy duty cutting, just don't go too long in between cuts. The edger part works quite well but that's not it's primarily function. I like that it has too modes. By keeping the mode on setting 1 I can usually cut the entire yard on one battery. It's really easy to clean up and stores easily too.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: works FANTASTIC,,
customer_reviews.text: works FANTASTIC ,,,Please get this one ,,,, comes with 2 ,, 20 A, Lithium Battery and charger ,,,,,,,,,,any LESS will not .......WOW YOU...........GET IT... Also got recommended, three extra black and Decker refill spools,,,,, didn't get to them yet,,,,, two months of joy.........
customer_reviews.author: Benny Rappa

customer_reviews.title: Suits my needs
customer_reviews.text: I've used both a gas powered and electric trimmer before using this one. While the battery powered one is less powerful, it does the job. One unexpected benefit was that the battery powered trimmer doesn't throw hardly any chewed-up grass at my shoes and jeans. If you're just needing to trim grass and a small amount of weeds around your yard, this is the way to go. Plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: The best trimmer I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much!!! It’s absolutely the best thing invented since sliced bread! I have always had a cumbersome electric trimmer in the past because as a woman, I prefer a lighter weight trimmer. I have a huge yard & hates dragging the cord around the yard! This trimmer eliminates all that! I charge one battery while using the other & have NEVER run out of power! I love this trimmer!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Noriega

customer_reviews.title: Black+Decker Weed-Eater New Addition to My Family!!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I can't say I am looking forward to weed-eating, but with this product, I look forward to weed-eating :) I have three acres I have to keep cut, along with 25 trees to trim around, so I just bit the bullet, and spent a little to get another great Black+Decker product. I am finding I have been missing out on a lot of fun!
customer_reviews.author: PRISMISSPP

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to assemble, just 2 screws. Lightweight, as advertised. Length adjustment easiest if all the various weed-eaters I've had over the years. Love the dual power. Easy to adjust for needs, either the high power or the lower power with more battery time. Both worked well, easy to adjust back and forth and definitely lengthened the battery use when on the lower setting. Can use my older 20 v batteries as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy K

customer_reviews.title: The difference is like night and day
customer_reviews.text: Does not have near enough power, especially when compared to electric trimmers. Batteries are ridiculous as far as consumption / trimming achieved. Returned this and bought a black and Decker electric trimmer instead (same size trimmer). The difference is like night and day! I would only recommend this if you absolutely positively must use the battery version for whatever reason.
customer_reviews.author: Susan  Bandy

customer_reviews.title: Has worked great over the past several months
customer_reviews.text: Has worked great over the past several months. Not a huge yard but many areas that require a trimmer versus mower. Gets right up against the railroad ties with the attached wheel guide and cuts very well. Doesn't cut through the heavy, matted grass near the edges, but a couple of passes after switching to the edger and placing it on Level 2 cuts through it with ease. Batteries have lasted through 2 1/2-3 uses and the switch between edging and trimming is cake. Very happy with this, especially with two batteries and the lightweight aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Christopherson

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for getting the job done
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for getting the job done. I manage rental properties, and this is a perfect size for loading into my vehicle. I also like how light it is and that has multiple functions (such as a the wheel you can run along curbs and use to edge sidewalks). It isn't quite as powerful as an electric string trimmer, but I find it so convenient to use that I don't mind trimming a little more often. The battery life is also fantastic, I have yet to use the extra battery when I'm using it.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Gottfried

customer_reviews.title: HALF THE EFFORT, TWICE AS FAST--A GREAT TOOL.
customer_reviews.text: `SO liberating to get rid of gasoline or electric cords. This is a sturdy, lighweight, well engineered, powerful weed eater. IT whirrrrrs, and the grass falls away like butter. THE available refills and replacement parts are great. 20 volt battery is exchangable with other 20-volt BLACK AND DECKER tools. I have begun replacing all my tools with these battery operated toold (limb saw scizzors, long arm hedge trimmer, handheld 22'' hedge clippers...and will get the rull range of tools in this series. The work is so much easier, and in half the time, really, no joke.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Guillory

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer with horrible ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: It is still working after 2 years but the straight handle really hurts my wrist when I use it, the pistol handle one is far better ergonomically but it died and I do not know why that would be related to the handle design.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Dunaj

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful Weed Eater
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful Weed Eater. I bought it for my husband and I have used it more than him. It is very light and doesn't hurt your back to use it. The weight is for the most part even through out the whole thing. No bulky back end. Smooth trim to the yard. The batteries seem to last a long time. Longer if you leave it on 1 of course. But don't be afraid to use 2 either. The battery still hold up. I would recommend this to anyone! All the other wives are asking about this as well.
customer_reviews.author: Royce McQuaig

customer_reviews.title: Way better than my older B&D string edger.
customer_reviews.text: I love this new string trimmer. The wheel on it makes it easy to edge along driveway and sidewalk. It telescopes so it can be adjusted to fit shorter people--like me. The batteries are fast charging. I didn't expect to notice such a difference from the older B&D trimmer but this thing is so much lighter in weight and is just so much easier to edge...the shaft can be swiveled with just a click and the wheel is great for going along flower beds, border gardens etc.
customer_reviews.author: camper007

customer_reviews.title: Love Black and Decker
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this all summer and I still love it. Great power and excellent for trimming around sidewalks. I have to do a large ditch which takes about 45 mins. The 2 batteries that came with this will almost get it done. I use the power setting and it will last longer on the low setting. I already have a B&D trimmer that came with a removable deck. Have used it 3 years. I also have several of the Matrix tools so in all I have 5 batteries. I have been very pleased with all the B&D tools I have gotten to use with these batteries.
customer_reviews.author: paul umfleet

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product Helps A Lot Trimming the Lawn!
customer_reviews.text: The product works good and does meet my expectations. It helped a lot for reaching places where the lawn mower can't reach. The weed trimmer and edger is easy to use. It's easy to start. I wanted a trimmer that runs on a battery, instead of using a mixture of gas and oil, it's easier for me. The trimmer cuts good, and after I used it on my lawn, my lawn looked much better! Nice product! The product comes with two lithium batteries. I have had the trimmer for a few weeks, and so far it's been okay.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I literally was laughed at by my family when this was delivered. I love it and no one is laughing now. I ordered the larger battery for longer life between charges. It is so light and easy to use. I can do our larger yard with 20 trees in no time. Don't be afraid to order it for a big yard if you want a light trimmer. No bumping to advance string, no mixing or filling with fuel. Love it love it love it.
customer_reviews.author: Honour

customer_reviews.title: Who's got my next lawn?
customer_reviews.text: Thing is so dope, I was hoping I missed spots when I finished using it the first time. Now I get strange looks from my neighbors as I weed whack up and down my street. Currently out of lawns and looking for more.
customer_reviews.author: Clueless Wallob

customer_reviews.title: Light to use but plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Plenty of power to edge my bermuda grass. So much easier than my big Mclaren gas powered edger. But you do have to fiddle with the string occasionally. It broke off down inside the cassette and I thought it had already run out. The new prewound spools are expensive and they dont last that long trimming the grass along a concrete driveway. Im going to try winding string myself onto the empty spool. Light to carry and work with. Not very ergonomic controls for edging where you have to hold it upsidedown and twist your hand around to press the button.but I love it anyway. Lithium batteries rule!
customer_reviews.author: Mad Ross

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed using this trimmer and edger. It is light weight and I find that the 2 batteries are plenty to trim around the house, fence, and utilities plus edging the driveway and side walk using the "stronger" option. I found the squeeze lever to be a bit of a pain at first but I have gotten used to it. The fact that the shaft can be adjusted is a bonus as it doesn't take up much space for storage. I am very pleased so far with this purchase. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: BKW

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until it stopped.
customer_reviews.text: When the unit worked, it performed great. I also loved the self-feeding feature. The switch to rotate to edger mode did not work as expected, my husband had to twist it harder than expected for it to click and maintain its position. On full charge, first battery lasted about 20 min; with second battery it sputtered and constantly shut off. I tried a third fully charged battery and again the trimmer sputtered and shut off.
customer_reviews.author: m.linton

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! We have a medium sized yard, probably around 5,000 sq ft. This takes care of our needs. We use it to trim and edge. Sometimes we can get by with just one battery for the whole yard--but it's pretty run down so sometimes we use 2 batteries to get the whole job done. It honestly just depends on how much there is to do. Great product though. Nice and light-weight. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: BWadds3

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great, easy to assemble but not sure if the cutting cord advances automatically
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great, easy to assemble.. quiet, and gets the job done.. 4 stars because my hand hurts after 30 minutes from holding the switch down..wish it would stay on. So after using it on my front yard.. I don't think the cutting string advanced automatically like the manual says..
customer_reviews.author: hijenist

customer_reviews.title: Much more convenient than a corded electric trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a corded electric string trimmer for about $50 (also Black & Decker) but I quickly discovered that it was a hassle to use due to the cumbersome extension cord, and so I ended up avoiding doing work that needed to be done. It was well worth it to pay twice as much (still cheap anyway) for this trimmer that runs off of battery power. The battery lasts plenty long to do everything that's needed around my yard, and it comes with a second battery in case you need it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Goodell

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this a 5 star if only the batteries had longer outputs. Battery recharging takes longer than I anticipated; good thing B&D provides an extra. Nice touch. Not a bad unit for light to medium duty yard use. Over the years B&D has gone downhill in my opinion, but with this unit - thus far - it does the job. I purchased this as a replacement for a B&D that lasted quite awhile. I had an inventory of "spools" and figured why not look for a comparable trimmer using the same type. Found it! Recommended purchase.
customer_reviews.author: siberianmo

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy, Best yard tool I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: the black and decker trimmer edger operates exceptionally well. the unit has worked flawlessly. the unit comes with two lithlum batteries which provide more than ample power to edge and trim along the sidewalk, driveway and around my property. the unit has reduced the time to get the job done from more than an hour with my old electric trimmer to to less than twenty minutes. the edger is extremely light and produces ample power to do a professional trimming job. with minimal effort. So far, I am more than 100% satisfied with my new black and decker unit..
customer_reviews.author: Bob M

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer for basic trimming where mower can't reach
customer_reviews.text: Great trimmer for basic trimming where mower can't reach. This model comes with 2 rechargeable batteries and a charger. I weed whack a total of 250 feet along fence line and porch and 1 battery always does the job using the #2 highest setting. The self feeding spool seems to work well and does not seem to use up the line too quickly at all like I read in a few reviews that it did, For my use, it is 10 times much better than my previous hard to start 20 pulls and smelly gas/oil mix 2-stroke Bolins gas trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: RICHIE MONITEAU

customer_reviews.title: it is powerful enough to easily cut tall grass and weeds
customer_reviews.text: I debated a long time between the 20 and 40 volt versions. Decided on the 20 specifically because it came with a second battery. We have a 1/4 ache lot with normal trimming requirements, It usually takes just slightly over one full battery. Overall it works well, it is powerful enough to easily cut tall grass and weeds. It is super light which is a huge plus, my 11 year old thinks it is fun and can do it easily. (yeah for me).
customer_reviews.author: KateNBrad

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I'd really like to give this a 3+ but it's not an option. Pros: 1. light weight 2. reliable electric drive 3. line self feed works well Cons: 1. struggles with any sizable weed 2. small caliber line (.065"), only one filament exposed 3. small sweep area 12" If you have a lot of fences or a serious weed problem, try the 40 volt version or get a gas model with .095" line. My wife likes this because it's light and easy to use. I like it for trimming around plants and hard to get areas.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a typical neighborhood lot. Came with 2 batteries and estimate each one lasts 20-30 min. Have used it most of the summer and not had a battery wear down yet during use. My lot is 85 x 150 and I have a pool and deck to go around. The line feed works great. Have not had any issues or complaints since I purchased it. Did a lot of homework and wanted to switch from gas to electric/battery. This one fit the bill and has a reputable name. Highly recommended if you have similar size property as me. Hoping the batteries last many years.
customer_reviews.author: ScotZ71

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC tool for what it is but know its limits...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3/4 acre yard which is really two different yards: a pretty, green suburban front & a heavily wooded back that goes to a creek. I wouldn't use this down at creek (have had a gas one w/brush head for yrs for that) but this thing ROCKS for the front! it weighs easily 1/2 what the gas one does (% ~2/3 the length), doesn't require gas (/oil premix) & w/the aftermarket 5.0AH batteries ( it easily lasts several mowing/trimming cycles between charges! bottom line: FANTASTIC for "green" yards but get a high capacity aftermarket battery!
customer_reviews.author: Thomassidneylane

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but does not hold up
customer_reviews.text: Wheel Broke off after a year and two months, also the lock mechanism to go from edging to weed whacking also Broke. I live in Colorado, and we have a short on mowing. season. I would say I probably got about 15 uses out of this
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight trimmer, I purchased to replace a gasoline trimmer. I was amazed at the light weight and power of this trimmer, I was able to trim weeds up to 2 ft with ease. With the higher setting, it made short work of the larger weeds that had overgrown the garden. I was also pleased with the edger. My only complaint is that it did not have a "Lock" mode so you can run it without having to continuously squeeze the trigger, but this was a minor inconvenience, and much easier to use and maintain than the gasoline trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: JayJay

customer_reviews.title: A trim trimmer/edger
customer_reviews.text: Good light weight trimmer edger. Couldn't wait to try it out, wasn't disappointed. Trimmed then edged the front yard. Then on to the back yard. Did it all on one battery, Glad I bought this one, saves dragging the cord around, and the weight of the gas edger 3 in 1 tool I have is just too heavy. Also having make changes and repairs every spring. Got to be too much. Glad I got the light weight. I still have the big boys if I need to do more than this Black and Decker can handle, but I don't see that happening.
customer_reviews.author: chief

customer_reviews.title: We love it even though we're having auto-feed problems.
customer_reviews.text: It cuts great and the batteries are more than adequate for our smallish yard. The wheel makes beautiful edging easy. It works so much better and is easier to handle than the gas powered one we threw away when it sprung a leak in the gas line. Repairing it would have cost about the same as purchasing this one brand new. I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars because we can't get the line to auto-feed. I changed my review from 4 to 5 stars today. We've been using the trimmer for 3 weeks now and the auto-feed problem fixed itself. The edging wheel makes edging a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: P. Friesen

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 Acre: no problem
customer_reviews.text: My gas trimmer died and I was hesitant about battery. I have a large yard with plenty of tall grass at times. I now own 6 B+D products and have 5 20V batteries. The more you own the better you'll be. I was able to do my whole yard on one fully charged battery. The only caveat being is that you have to leave it at #1 setting or you will need multiple batteries. It was still powerful enough to get the job done but you do have to slow your pace.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: A great price on a solid, well-performing product.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful motor cuts through the weeds easily. I love not being held back with an electric cord. One battery gets me through most of my uses for it - 2 batteries can take care of fanatical days when I do the whole acre. 100% Pro - 0% Con. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wlaz

customer_reviews.title: Product okay, customer service rocks.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't run long, especially for the amount of time it takes to charge a battery. Pole has dismantled itself. Otherwise easy to use, powerful enough at the beginning of the charge, but definitely dwindles as it's used. I have had to call Black+Decker twice because of failed parts (string feeder and battery charger), and each time the company has been quick and generous in addressing my needs.
customer_reviews.author: islegirl

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for my older B&D GrassHog
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for my older B&D GrassHog! I am in my 60's and can handle this with no problems. It does a great job and I'm glad I purchased it. My only complaint is that is uses different batteries, 20 volt so my perfectly good 18volt batteries had to be given away to my neighbor to use with her Grass Hog! Every time they come out with a newer version of the same product, they change something just enough to cost more money again! Other than that, I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: BeagleMama

customer_reviews.title: A pleasure to use
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I both love this trimmer/edger and having a second battery ensures that we get all our trimming done without waiting. Our old trimmer was cumbersome to use as the whole top section of the trimmer was the battery and it was a pain in the neck disconnecting the battery, but this LST420 is simple to change the battery and quite a bit lighter than our old trimmer. I highly recommend the Black and Decker LST420 20 volt trimmer/edger.
customer_reviews.author: E.J. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Decent trimmer, terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: it is an ok trimmer, not an effective edger. Not especially powerful, even for a 20V. The biggest issue is the battery life. It might run for 30 min on a good day. I have a tiny yard, and one fully charged battery will not finish the job. If you need your trimmer to run for more than 30 min, ever, do not purchase this product. It will do fine for very small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Buckwalter

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with product
customer_reviews.text: The product is light and does the job in my small yard. It sure beats hauling out the extension cord everytime you need to do the yard. I was so impressed that I ordered a hedge trimmer (same battery type) and will see how that does. Maybe, I can become extension cord free when working around the house which does not have many outside plugs. Please note that my yard is small but I work in the yard weekly and I have paths between beds of roses that need to be weed wacked to keep the grass trimmed. I live in Hawaii so work is year round.
customer_reviews.author: Mililani Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome weed eater
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this battery operated weed eater. Due to husbands health I am having to take over the weed eating and I needed something light weight that I could stand to pack around and yet do the job in our very large yard. This works great and I've yet to use up an entire battery on one round. Our daughter is so impressed she intends to order herself one!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for old lady :D Not to heavy for fused spine, works great
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for us! We have a medium size yard (takes about 1.5 hours to mow with a push mower) and I didn't want to haul around a gas eater since I have a fused spine. This one has enough power to whack through some big weeds and the batteries do last about 30 minutes each (when you run it on the lower power setting (less power, longer usage)) great to just leave sitting by the garage door to grab and go ... SUPER EASY to use. The cord is already installed and you don't bang it on the ground to get more cord out, it just comes out as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Leavitt

customer_reviews.title: Love This Thing
customer_reviews.text: I generally dislike battery powered tools. They do not have enough power and they are constantly running out of power. Thanks to TWO batteries, this one does not. Batteries are small and you can easily carry the spare in a back pocket and switch batteries when your first battery runs out. Works great, no more mixing fuel, storing gasoline, trying to start some POS gas powered trimmer. Good price too, BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth W. Weigel

customer_reviews.title: Handy and Great for Light to Medium-light work
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for light work around the edges of the yard, grass and light weeds; don't expect to do the drainage ditch with it; beats getting out the cords when you just have a light to moderate job to do. My wife loves it; I even used it for a big job with reasonable success. I have extra batteries from buying other B&D tools so I just kept popping them in. The corded version is several times as powerful of course.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: This not for someone with lots of weeds or a large yard. It is not for a pro. Battery's last about 30 minutes. I had to buy a 3rd battery so I could finish my yard. It works for me but I can see why it has bad reviews. If I had a wish list for the LST 420 it would be; 1) longer battery life 2) a bit more power 3) better cutting string It is nice to just pickup the trimmer, slap in a battery and go t work. No extension cords or gas to deal with. Convenience is why it works and it does what I need. I'm keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great Yard Tool
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use and lightweight. I trimmed my 1/2 residential lot/sidewalk/driveway with one battery and power to spare. The power can be adjusted for normal trimming or heavier weed trimming. The roller guide makes it easy to trim sidewalks and driveways....you don't have to carry the weight of the machine, just guide it along the walkway!
customer_reviews.author: shoppergirl

customer_reviews.title: chops down mustard weeds like a breeze
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love!!!!! So I was worried that this wouldn't handle the job I needed it for because everywhere I saw the recommended use was just for grass. I have 3 acres of THICK weeds and sucker trees and this worked like a champ! I was able to clear 100 feet from the perimiter of the house of 4 foot tall weeds with one battery. I'm so impressed. I'm happy I bought this and know that i will be using it tons.
customer_reviews.author: Mamaa4444

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER LST420 20V MAX Lithium High Performance Trimmer and Edger, 12"
product_meta.description: With a dual-mode switch for extra power or extra runtime, this battery-powered trimmer and edger features POWERDRIVE transmission to tackle tough overgrowth. Easily converts from trimmer to edger. Included Components: LST420 20V MAX* Cordless Trimmer/Edger, (2) LBXR2020-OPE 20V MAX* Batteries, (1) Charger, (1) AF-100 Spool, (1) Guard, (1) Handle; Power Source: Lithium Ion
feature_bullets: The PowerDrive Transmission delivers more power from the motor to the cutting string so you can get the job done faster
Runtime Extension Technology with dual mode accelerator switch for high performance or longer run time
The Automatic Feed Spool ensures continuous work without bumping
Includes (2) 2.0-Amp-hour lithium battery packs- each battery pack delivers 33% more capacity than the LBXR20 battery pack
Part of the 20V MAX System - A System that Demands Attention. 1 Battery fits multiple tools
